title: Convert opende libraries to be static

content.raw:
This issue comes from discussion on pull request #909

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach would be to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files.  After this first step, we will be able to define as ```GAZEBO_VISIBLE``` the functions on ```gazebo/physics/ode``` and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do. 

@nkoenig commented about the need of access ODE core features and be able to get a pointer to the underlying physics engine.

This issue comes from discussion on pull request #909

As of now, we were generating 4 shared libraries which are not really being used anywhere more than in gazebo_physics_ode. Since they are a fork of the official ode libraries I would prefer no to re-distribute them (libs and headers) if possible.

The approach would be to change them to be static and statically linked them into gazebo_physics_ode and not to install all related headers files. After this first step, we will be able to define as GAZEBO_VISIBLE the functions on gazebo/physics/ode and all symbols from our ode fork will keep not exported, which I believe is a good thing to do.
